meanings.definition: Not easily evaporated at normal temperatures
meanings.sent1: The nonvolatile oil stayed in the container without disappearing.
meanings.sent2: The nonvolatile substance remained in its solid form even in the heat.
meanings.sent3: The nonvolatile liquid refused to turn into vapor, much to the surprise of the scientists.
meanings.sent4: Her nonvolatile determination was like a rock, unyielding to any obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The nonvolatile smell of the flower lingered in the room for days, refusing to fade away.

meanings.sent1: The nonvolatile friendship between them lasted through thick and thin.
meanings.sent2: His nonvolatile opinion on the matter remained steadfast despite the arguments.
meanings.sent3: The nonvolatile marker ink on the whiteboard seemed to defy erasure, much to the teacher's frustration.
meanings.sent4: Her nonvolatile love for him was like an unbreakable bond that nothing could sever.
meanings.sent5: The nonvolatile memory of that day etched itself in his mind, refusing to fade with time.
